theatre.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed
theatre.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: an open-air theatre  (=a theatre that is outside)
theatre.translation[0].definitions[1].de: plays as a form of entertainment
theatre.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Yeats’ plays are great poetry but they are not good theatre  (=good entertainment).
He’s really interested in literature and the theatre.
theatre.translation[0].definitions[2].de: the work of acting in, writing, or organizing plays
theatre.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: She’s been working in the theatre over thirty years.
theatre.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a building where films are shown
theatre.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: ‘Bambi’ was the first movie I ever saw in the theater.
theatre.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a special room in a hospital where medical operations are done
theatre.translation[0].definitions[5].de: a large area where a war is being fought
theatre.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: the Pacific theater during World War II
theatre.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: stage
the raised area on which the actors, musicians etc perform
He came on stage to rapturous applause.
The band will appear live on stage for the first time in three years.
the stalls
the lower level of seats
He had a seat in the stalls.
We paid $100 for a seat in the orchestra.
the circle
the higher level of seats
They were sitting in the balcony.
the orchestra pit
the space below the stage where the musicians sit
The actress fell into the orchestra pit.
box office
the place in a theatre where you buy tickets
Collect your tickets at the box office.
programme
a small book that you buy when you go to the theatre that gives information about the play and the performers
His name is not in the programme.
Do you want me to buy you a program?
interval
a short period of time between the parts of a play or show when the audience can talk or have a drink
We got a drink in the interval.
